data.description:
The current Profile Page is very vague and has little details 

Things would be good if we have 
- [X] More Details 
- [X] Links 
- [X] Option to edit details
- [ ] Option to Change/Remove the current DP
- [X] Removal of GitHub Username at top and start using [amFOSS Page](https://amfoss.in/@abhishekbvs)

notes_data.body: changed the description
marked the task **Option to edit details** as completed
marked the task **More Details** as completed
marked the task **Links** as completed
marked the task **Removal of GitHub Username at top and start using [amFOSS Page](https://amfoss.in/@abhishekbvs)** as completed
I also have few more to add - [ ] If the gitlab/github username doesn't exist we can hide the icon - [ ] The list can be matched to parent and the padding can be set to the members inside the list

data.title: Improve the Profile Page

data.description:
Closes #18
Closes #28 

Changes: Add alert notification if a user doesn't enter his/her credentials.

Screenshots of the change: 

![login_validation](/uploads/173f17e178d90484db1693c30019fd7b/login_validation.gif)

notes_data.body: changed the description

@Chromicle I don't think this will work. A validator also returns and sets the error text without being explicitly told to do so. 
So in both cases error text is being set itself.

Great work @athiranair2000, instead of using `validator` you can use errortext in decoration

Please go through this https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53424916/textfield-validation-in-flutter
Yeah, this is the same as the thing I suggested. It won't look good in our approach unless we increase the height to make the text stay inside the text box even after jumping.
Also, you can go through [this](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/15400) link. Maybe this is related to that.

Yeah, I guess we can have it like the way you suggested or maybe we can have a separate Text right above the submit button. I am fine with any of the solution. Check which looks better and implement that.

I thought of a new text view. But I think our current UI looks good. If we change some spacings, it might look awkward. So I think toast is the best option. 

@athiranair2000 can you please make a toast in the validator instead of returning a string for the error text?

data.description:
**Describe the bug**

If the user presses the Login button without entering anything in username and password then it doesn't show any alert notification.

**Screenshot**

![No_message](/uploads/82d66a5723b4c850f0c52e3019f89ea5/No_message.gif)

notes_data.body: Hi, can I work on this issue?
@athiranair2000 sure, go ahead :)

closed via merge request !46

data.title: No notification in login page

data.description:
Changes:  
When the user logs in to the app for the first time, their credentials get stored in the app database. The next time the app is opened, the database is checked for credentials. If they exist, the app navigates directly to the home page.

Video:
![Screenrecorder-2020-04-26-21-55-39-488](/uploads/a1d9a80934fa38a9925240222f44fde5/Screenrecorder-2020-04-26-21-55-39-488.mp4)
